how are you monitoring your cpu speeds?
cpufreq-info   type that into a terminal.  does the `available cpu frequency steps` match to what your processor can do?
it says that the performance policy can use between 800MHz and 1.14GHz, how do I adjust the policies?
when using: root@martin-laptop:/# cpufreq-set -f 1.9GHz  ( I believe that's what the selector in the panel item does anyway), it goes straight to 800MHz
i think you're using the syntax wrong -f is to set which to use .. Ghz or Mhz  the -d and -u will set min and max .. for example cpufreq-set -f Ghz -m 1.0 -u 1.9
which governor are you using? that page indicates `userspace` needs to be used to set a constant frequency
possibly you should be using sudo from your user instead of root shell.. that means userspace is your current governor

i don't know a solution. i just know (supposedly) how to set the frequency. not sure why it isn't working for you.
